title: Aural Microsuction Training & The Hearing Lab Store for Professionals - Ear Wax Clinic
description: Train to be an aural microsuction practitioner with The Hearing Lab Store and join the Ear Wax Clinic network.
rawContent:
Aural Microsuction Training & The Hearing Lab Store for Professionals

The Hearing Lab Store is part of The Hearing Lab Group, which provides audiological services to the public, audiological training to medical and health professionals, and audiology products to the industry. Owned and managed by audiologists, we truly understand the hearing industry, and all our training courses are tried and tested by ourselves in our own work environment at Liverpool Hearing Centre.

View our training calendar

Practical

By training only registered ear care professionals, medical practitioners, registered nurses, health care assistants with aural care experience, and qualified audiologists, you will already have a high level of expertise and knowledge. Therefore, we can focus on developing the practical skills needed to complete the procedure safely, confidently, and professionally.

Personal

With a maximum of four trainees per trainer, we'll work up close and personal with you so you'll gain all the confidence you need to add this to your practice immediately. Constant supervision whilst using mannequin heads and then each other means you can qualify with the utmost confidence in your ability. If you need further supervision then top up sessions will be arranged.

Convenient

We can come to you and you practice on your own clients, family and friends. They trust you the most and are definitely the best ears to train on. You may also join another person or group if that's more convenient for you. We run a number of courses every month around the UK.


Learn more

"I have completed the course and can thoroughly recommend this to any hearing care professional. The course is well structured with a good balance of theory and practical, the knowledge and guidance is excellent on the range of equipment available to suit the practitioner and it's safe effective use." Tony Gunnell RHAD FSHAA Technical Training
